head.title: FAQ — services, SEO, timelines & pricing | OBRIYM
head.desc: Answers about fast SEO-ready websites and web apps, 2–4 week timelines, multilingual, e-commerce, analytics, GDPR, security and maintenance.

faq.h1: Answers about building fast SEO websites and web apps
faq.lead: OBRIYM is a full-cycle web agency. We ship fast and secure websites and web apps with a focus on SEO, performance (Core Web Vitals), accessibility and conversions. Below are answers about the stack (Next.js / React / Svelte / Astro / Qwik...), e-commerce, multilingual SEO, integrations, analytics, GDPR/Consent Mode, security, maintenance and pricing.
faq.h2: OBRIYM is a full-cycle web agency

services.a: We design and build fast SEO-optimized websites and web apps: corporate sites, landing pages, blogs, e-commerce, portals, microservices and integrations. Modern stack (Qwik/Next.js), design systems, headless CMS (Prismic/Contentful/Strapi), analytics, SEO, accessibility (WCAG 2.1), security and post-launch support.

timeline.q: How long does a website take and what are the stages?
timeline.a: Typically 2–4 weeks depending on complexity. Stages: briefing & planning → UX prototype → UI design → development → content & localization → SEO/analytics → testing → release. E-commerce/integrations may take longer; we fix scope and deadlines in the proposal.

pricing.q: How much does a website cost?
pricing.a: From €1500 for base projects. Includes design, layout, development, baseline SEO (Title/H1, meta, semantics, sitemap, robots, Open Graph), analytics integration and onboarding. Extras: e-commerce, CRM integrations, multilingual, copywriting, SEO strategy, visuals.

seo.q: What exactly do you do for SEO?
seo.a: Technical SEO (canonicals, hreflang, sitemap.xml, robots.txt), semantic HTML structure, proper headings (H1–H3), metadata, Open Graph/Twitter Cards, structured data (Organization, WebSite + SearchAction, BreadcrumbList, Service/Article), speed & Core Web Vitals (LCP, CLS, INP), internal linking, clean URLs.

performance.q: How do you achieve high speed and Core Web Vitals?
performance.a: Qwik/Next.js with SSR and fine-grained reactivity, critical CSS, optimized images (AVIF/WebP, sizes, decoding=async/fetchpriority), lazy-loading, caching, CDN, preconnect/preload, minimal JS bundle and control of render-blocking resources; Lighthouse/PageSpeed to keep green.

ecommerce.q: What e-commerce solutions do you offer?
ecommerce.a: Shopify stores or custom storefronts on Next.js/Qwik with payments (Stripe/WayForPay/PayPal), product management, cart/checkout, taxes, SEO for categories/products, filters, CRM/ERP and email integrations.

cms.q: Which CMS do you recommend: headless or WordPress?
cms.a: For performance and scale — headless CMS (Prismic/Contentful/Strapi) with JAMstack. If you prefer a classic setup — optimized WordPress. We choose based on editorial needs, SEO and budget.

i18n.q: Do you build multilingual sites and how does that affect SEO?
i18n.a: Yes: localized routes (uk/en/it), proper hreflang and canonical, localized Title/Description/H1, translated content and media text, keyword mapping per language — critical for international SEO and rich snippets.

a11y.a: Semantic markup, contrast, keyboard navigation, focus styles, ARIA, sr-only texts, alt text, logical heading hierarchy. Better UX and often better SEO.

analytics.q: Which analytics and tracking do you set up?
analytics.a: Google Analytics 4 with Consent Mode, Google Tag Manager, events/conversions, pixels (Meta/LinkedIn), server webhooks, heatmaps if needed. Tracking only after user consent (GDPR/cookie banner).

security.q: Security, hosting and DevOps — how do you handle it?
security.a: Vercel/Fly.io/Cloudflare hosting, HTTPS, security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options), dependency updates, secret isolation, backups, uptime monitoring, logging.

maintenance.a: Yes: monitoring, dependency updates, minor fixes, performance tuning, content help, quarterly SEO audits. SLA on response and fixes.

handover.q: Will there be training and transfer of ownership?
handover.a: Yes. Onboarding for editors/marketing, documentation, transfer of accesses, repository and ownership. You can maintain internally or keep us on support.

migration.q: Do you handle migrations/redesigns of existing sites?
migration.a: Yes. We migrate content, preserve URL structure (or set 301 redirects), restore metadata/schema, verify indexing, optimize speed and UX. Pre-launch technical audit included.

integrations.a: CRM (HubSpot/Pipedrive), email (Resend/Mailgun), payments (Stripe/WayForPay), calendars/booking, webhooks, search, maps, marketing tools, analytics, chat widgets.
